column4: i have tried installing network manager, and it seems to install without error but there is no interface for me to try and configure my wireless network.  Can anyone help?
start nm-applet
thanks for the response but how do I start it?
press alt-f2 and type nm-applet
it will be saved to your session and started automatically from there on
I ran it but still nothing. nothing appeared
the interface appears in the notification-area, near the clock
it's just a simple icon when you click it, it will show you a list of network interfaces
- nope, its not there.  The normal network connection icon is there, but not what I would have thought network manager is
the icon looks like the normal network connection icon, do you have 2 of them?
no, nothing. sorry but I think there is a problem elsewhere.  Is there a way to see if the process is running at all?
hmm.. you could check if the process is actually running
sorry but how do I do that. I am a complete newbee to linux.
terry, system -> administration -> system monitor
i was just looking how it's done from the menus ;)
ok, I got the processes listed and there is 3 copies of nm-applet which are all sleeping
had a bit of a network problem.  sorry i might have missed any of your replies.  I will repost my last one
ok, I got the processes listed and there is 3 copies of nm-applet which are all sleeping
that's a bit odd.. do you have any NetworkManager processes?
nah, no "networkmanager", just 3 "nm-applet"'s (3 because I ran it 3 times from the run dialog box
odd, you could try rebooting once.
Ok, I will try that and let you know.
